intro: Leochilus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered leechgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in panicles. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
